intro: Cupressus lawsoniana var. filiformis, commonly known as the Lawson's cypress dwarf form, is a unique variant of the Lawson's cypress. It is characterized by its slender, columnar growth habit and dense foliage. The plant features scale-like leaves that are tightly packed along the branches, giving it a compact appearance. It is native to the western United States and thrives in well-drained soils. This variety is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its elegant, narrow form and year-round foliage.
